Description: The Flight into Egypt; the Virgin and Child on a donkey facing right on a path in a wooded landscape, with five angels in a date palm bending the branches towards Joseph who reaches out for a date, and three lizards left foreground. c.1470-74 Engraving
Curator's comments: Part of a Gothic P watermark visible on the surface of the sheet The remarkably accurate portrayal of a very rare Canarian dragon tree on the left side of this composition has led Arwed Ulrich Koch, to conclude that Schongauer must have visited the Iberian peninsula to make an accurate depiction of the plant (see A.U. Koch, 'Der botanische Nachweis einer Reise Martin Schongauers zur Iberischen Halbinsel', in Mitteilungen der Deutschen Dendrologischen Gesellschaft, vol. 93, 2008, pp. 69-76). Flechsig first suggested that Schongauer may have visited Spain as a youth (Flechsig, Schongauer, Strasbourg, 1944, p. 120) and Koch later published further ideas to support evidence for such a journey ( see A.U. Koch in Weltkunst, no.9, 1993; no.20 1994; and no.10 1998).
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (7)
Lehrs 1908-34 / Geschichte und kritische Katalog des deutschen, niederländischen und französischen Kupferstichs im XV Jahrhundert (V.62.7)
